meanings.definition: The natural color, texture, and appearance of the skin, especially of the face.
meanings.sent1: Her complexion was radiant and glowing after spending the day in the sun.
meanings.sent2: People with fair complexions are more prone to sunburn.
meanings.sent3: The clown's colorful complexion made everyone at the party smile.
meanings.sent4: The artist used a variety of colors to paint the woman's complexion on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The baby's soft complexion was as smooth as silk.

meanings.definition: The overall character or quality of something, especially in terms of complexity or variety.
meanings.sent1: The complexity of the situation required careful planning.
meanings.sent2: The book's plot had many twists, adding to its intriguing complexion.
meanings.sent3: The party took on a new complexion when unexpected guests arrived.
meanings.sent4: The city's skyline changed its complexion with the addition of modern skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The project's complexion shifted as new ideas were introduced.
